item.title: 据 Business Insider 报道，马斯克的 xAI 裁员数百名数据注释员
item.description: 据《商业内幕》（Business Insider）周五报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 xAI 数据注释团队裁员至少 500 人。【原文：Elon Musk's xAI laid off at least 500 workers from its data annotation team, Business Insider reported on Friday.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，OpenAI 将与商业合作伙伴分享 8%的收入
item.description: 据 The Information 周五报道，OpenAI 预计到本十年末将与商业合作伙伴（即微软）分享约 8% 的收入，低于目前的 20%。【原文：OpenAI has projected to share about 8% of its revenue with commercial partners, namely Microsoft , by the end of the decade, down from the current 20%, The Information reported on Friday.】

item.title: 俄亥俄州和肯塔基州工厂的 UAW 工人与通用电气航空航天公司达成临时协议
item.description: 通用电气航空航天公司（GE Aerospace）俄亥俄州埃文代尔（Evendale）和肯塔基州埃兰格（Erlanger）工厂的联合汽车工人工会成员周五表示，已与该公司达成临时协议。【原文：Members of the United Auto Workers union at GE Aerospace's Evendale, Ohio, and Erlanger, Kentucky, facilities have reached a tentative agreement with the company, the union said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国处罚为芯片制造商中芯国际收购工具的两家中国公司
item.description: 美国政府发布公告称，美国周五对为中国顶级芯片制造商中芯国际收购美国芯片制造设备的两家中国公司进行了处罚，将其列入商务部限制贸易名单的32家实体之一。这 32 家公司中有 23 家在中国。【原文：The United States on Friday penalized two Chinese firms that acquired U.S. chipmaking equipment for China's top chipmaker SMIC, including them among 32 entities that were added to the Commerce Department's restricted trade list, according to a U.S. government posting. Twenty-three of the 32 were in China.】

item.title: 墨西哥拟对中国征收关税，比亚迪和特斯拉损失最大
item.description: 墨西哥拟对从中国进口的汽车征收 50% 的关税，电动汽车竞争对手比亚迪和特斯拉将成为最大的输家，这可能会对墨西哥快速增长的电动汽车市场造成打击，而美国传统的 "三大 "汽车制造商则不会受到影响。【原文：Electric car rivals BYD and Tesla are set to be the biggest losers from Mexico’s proposed 50 percent tariff on autos imported from China, triggering a likely blow to the fast-growing electric car market in Mexico while sparing the traditional "Big Three" U.S. car manufacturers.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司首席执行官与特朗普就 850 亿美元收购诺福克的计划举行会谈
item.description: 联合太平洋公司首席执行官吉姆-维纳（Jim Vena）在椭圆形办公室会见了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump），讨论了该公司拟以 850 亿美元收购诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern Corp）的事宜。【原文：Union Pacific Corp CEO Jim Vena met with U.S. President Donald Trump in the Oval Office to discuss the railroad's proposed $85 billion buyout of Norfolk Southern Corp , the company said on Friday, as it seeks regulatory approval for the biggest U.S. rail merger in decades.】

item.title: Alliance Laundry 在提交的美国首次公开募股文件中披露收入大幅增长
item.description: 随着 IPO 市场的持续火热，这家洗衣设备制造商周五在其美国首次公开募股文件中披露，Alliance Laundry 的收入在 2025 年上半年增长了近 15%，该公司的目标是在纽约证券交易所上市。【原文：Alliance Laundry's revenue rose nearly 15% in the first half of 2025, the laundry equipment maker disclosed on Friday in its U.S. initial public offering paperwork, aiming to list on the New York Stock Exchange as the IPO markets continue to run hot.】

item.title: 西南航空要求在登机前取下移动设备的电池
item.description: 美国西南航空公司周五表示，将以火灾风险为由，要求乘客在登机前取出电动轮椅和代步车上的可拆卸锂电池。【原文：Southwest Airlines said on Friday it will require passengers to take out removable lithium batteries from powered wheelchairs and scooters before boarding, citing fire risks.】

item.title: 消息人士称，贝森特与贝莱德的里德尔会面，继续物色下任美联储主席人选
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士称，在特朗普政府继续为美联储物色新主席之际，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周五在纽约会见了贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc）高管里克-里德尔（Rick Rieder）。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent met with BlackRock Inc executive Rick Rieder in New York on Friday, as the Trump administration continued its search for a new chair for the Federal Reserve, a source familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 博雅银行任命联席总裁，首席执行官莫伊尼汉表示将任职十年
item.description: 美国银行周五表示，任命迪安-阿塔纳西亚（Dean Athanasia）和吉姆-德马雷（Jim DeMare）为联席总裁，首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）加强了他在本十年末领导这家美国第二大银行的承诺。【原文：Bank of America appointed Dean Athanasia and Jim DeMare as co-presidents, the U.S. lender said on Friday, as CEO Brian Moynihan reinforced his commitment to lead the second-largest bank in the country through the end of the decade.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Corteva 探索分拆为两家独立公司
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，农业公司 Corteva 正在探索将其种子和农药业务拆分为两家独立公司。【原文：Agriculture company Corteva is exploring a breakup that would separate its seed and pesticide businesses into two separate companies, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回谷歌在 Epic Games 案中要求进一步暂停 Play 商店全面改革的请求
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周五未能说服美国一家上诉法院进一步冻结一项命令，该命令要求谷歌对其应用程序商店 Play 进行全面改革，同时谷歌在 "堡垒之夜"（Fortnite）视频游戏制造商 Epic Games 的诉讼中对这一决定提出质疑。【原文：Alphabet's Google on Friday failed to persuade a U.S. appeals court to further freeze an order forcing it to make sweeping reforms to its app store Play while it challenges the decision in a lawsuit by "Fortnite" video game maker Epic Games.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司人工智能和搜索高管罗比-沃克将离职
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，苹果公司最资深的人工智能高管之一罗比-沃克（Robby Walker）即将离职。【原文：Robby Walker, one of Apple's most senior artificial intelligence executives, is leaving the company, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 马萨诸塞州指控卡尔希经营非法体育博彩业务
item.description: 马萨诸塞州总检察长周五提起诉讼，要求阻止 Kalshi 在该州运营其体育预测平台，称这家纽约衍生品交易公司正在经营非法体育博彩业务。【原文：Massachusetts' attorney general filed a lawsuit on Friday seeking to block Kalshi from operating its sports prediction platform in the state, alleging the New York derivatives trading company was operating an illegal sports wagering business.】

item.title: Stellantis 停止开发电动公羊 1500 皮卡
item.description: Stellantis 公司周五表示，由于对全尺寸电动卡车的需求缓慢，该公司将停止生产 Ram 1500 电动皮卡。【原文：Stellantis is axing its Ram 1500 electric pickup, citing slow demand for full-size EV trucks, the company said Friday.】

item.title: 诉讼称马斯克的特斯拉公司雇用签证持有者而非美国人，这样可以少付工资
item.description: 周五，亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的电动汽车公司特斯拉（Tesla）在一桩诉讼中被指控在做出雇佣决定时偏袒签证持有者，而不是美国人，这样就可以少付工资。【原文：Tesla , the electric vehicle company led by billionaire Elon Musk, was accused in a lawsuit on Friday of favoring visa holders over Americans when making employment decisions so it can pay less.】

item.title: 美国农业部预计美国玉米收成创纪录，收获面积为 1933 年以来最大
item.description: 美国农业部周五表示，美国农民将收获自1933年以来最多英亩的玉米，谷物产量也将超过此前的预期，尽管作物产量将低于此前的预测。【原文：U.S. farmers will harvest the most acres of corn since 1933 and produce more of the grain than previously expected, even though crop yields will miss earlier forecasts, the U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称门票经销商 StubHub 首次公开募股超额认购 20 倍
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周五称，因市场波动而推迟了 4 月份在美国上市的门票分销商 StubHub，其计划首次公开发行股票的订单数量是现有股票数量的 20 多倍。【原文：Ticket reseller StubHub, which delayed its U.S. listing in April amid market volatility, has drawn over 20 times as many orders for its planned initial public offering as there are available shares, a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，泰雷兹、空中客车和莱昂纳多有望就价值 100 亿欧元的卫星合资公司达成初步协议
item.description: 欧洲航空航天集团莱昂纳多（Leonardo）、泰雷兹（Thales）和空中客车（Airbus）加倍努力，将它们的卫星业务合并成一家价值 100 亿欧元（117 亿美元）的合资企业，并正努力在未来几周内达成初步协议。【原文：Europe's aerospace groups Leonardo, Thales and Airbus have redoubled efforts to combine their satellite businesses into a 10 billion-euro ($11.7 billion) joint venture and are working towards hammering out an initial agreement in coming weeks, sources close to the matter told Reuters in recent days.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：亚马逊测试通用电动送货车，以实现气候目标
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，亚马逊公司一直在测试通用汽车公司的 BrightDrop 电动货车，因为这家电子商务巨头在继续探索减少其广泛的送货业务碳排放的方案。【原文：Amazon.com has been testing General Motors' BrightDrop electric van, as the e-commerce giant continues to explore options to reduce carbon emissions of its wide-spread delivery operation, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，Vista支持的设备管理软件公司Jamf正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，设备管理软件供应商 Jamf 正在探讨出售事宜，因为其股价疲软使其成为其他公司的主要收购对象。【原文：Device management software provider Jamf is exploring a sale as weakness in its stock price makes it a prime takeover candidate for other companies, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 公交技术公司 Via 估值 35 亿美元，纽交所首日股价下跌
item.description: Via Transportation 的股价周五在纽约证券交易所首次亮相时下跌了 4.4%，这家交通技术制造商的估值为 35 亿美元。【原文：Via Transportation shares fell 4.4% in their NYSE debut on Friday, valuing the transit technology maker at $3.5 billion.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯双胞胎的加密货币交易所 Gemini 在纳斯达克首秀表现强劲，估值达 44 亿美元
item.description: 双子座空间站（Gemini Space Station）股价周五在纳斯达克首次亮相时大涨 32.2%，为这家加密货币交易所带来了 44 亿美元的估值，并为数字资产公司在复苏的美国 IPO 市场上迎来光明的一周画上了句号。【原文：Gemini Space Station shares jumped 32.2% in their Nasdaq debut on Friday, giving the cryptocurrency exchange a valuation of $4.4 billion and capping a bright week for digital asset companies in a resurgent U.S. IPO market.】

item.title: 墨西哥监管机构规定，亚马逊和 MercadoLibre 上的卖家面临竞争壁垒
item.description: 墨西哥反垄断监督机构 Cofece 周五表示，对墨西哥电子商务市场的调查发现，亚马逊和 MercadoLibre 上的卖家面临竞争障碍。【原文：An investigation into Mexico's e-commerce market found that sellers on Amazon and MercadoLibre faced barriers to competition, the nation's anti-trust watchdog Cofece said on Friday.】

item.title: 维基百科不会对驳回其对《英国网络安全法案》的质疑提出上诉
item.description: 维基百科的运营商周五表示，不会就上个月在对英国《网络安全法案》的法律挑战中败诉一事提起上诉，该法案对平台提出了严格的新要求，并被批评可能会限制言论自由。【原文：The operator of Wikipedia said on Friday it would not appeal its defeat last month in a legal challenge to Britain's Online Safety Act, which sets tough new requirements for platforms and has been criticised for potentially curtailing free speech.】

item.title: 波音国防工人拒绝合同，罢工仍在继续
item.description: 周五，波音国防公司的罢工工人拒绝了该公司的最新合同提议。【原文：Striking workers at Boeing Defense rejected the company's latest contract offer on Friday.】

item.title: 黑岩咖啡吧首次登陆纳斯达克，股价大涨，估值达 12.7 亿美元
item.description: 黑岩咖啡吧 周五在纳斯达克首次上市时，股价上涨了 32.5%，连锁咖啡馆的估值达到 12.7 亿美元。【原文：Shares of Black Rock Coffee Bar rose 32.5% in their Nasdaq debut on Friday, valuing the cafe chain at $1.27 billion.】

item.title: Blackstone 支持的 Legence 首次上市后股价下跌，估值 27.5 亿美元
item.description: 周五，Legence 在纳斯达克首次上市时股价下跌 3.6%，使这家由 Blackstone 支持的工程和维护服务提供商的估值达到 27.5 亿美元。【原文：Shares of Legence fell 3.6% in their Nasdaq debut on Friday, giving the Blackstone-backed engineering and maintenance services provider a valuation of $2.75 billion.】

item.title: 独家报道阿斯利康暂停在英国投资 2.7 亿美元
item.description: 英国最大的公司阿斯利康（AstraZeneca）的一位发言人表示，该公司已暂停了在剑桥研究基地投资 2 亿英镑（2.7126 亿美元）的计划，这是最近一家从英国撤退的制药商。【原文：Britain's biggest company AstraZeneca has paused a planned 200 million pound ($271.26 million) investment in its Cambridge research site, a spokesperson said, the latest drugmaker to retreat from Britain.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》报道，特朗普官员将儿童死亡与 COVID 疫苗联系起来
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》周五援引四位熟知内情的人士的话报道，特朗普卫生官员正计划将冠状病毒疫苗与 25 名儿童的死亡联系起来，同时考虑限制儿童接种疫苗。【原文：Trump health officials are planning to link coronavirus vaccines to the deaths of 25 children as they consider limiting access to the shots, the Washington Post reported on Friday, citing four people familiar with the matter.】
